snippet: As a cost-saving alternative to traditional in-person sessions, more jails are now setting up computers so that family members can interact with prisoners via monitors.
abstract: Many jails around the country are setting up computers with Web cameras as a cost-saving alternative to traditional in-person visitations so that family members can interact with prisoners via monitors.
lead_paragraph: As a cost-saving alternative to traditional in-person sessions, more jails are now setting up computers so that family members can interact with prisoners via monitors.

headline.seo: Some Criticize Jails as They Move to Video Visits
headline.main: In-Person Visits Fade as Jails Set Up Video Units for Inmates and Families
headline.print_headline: In-Person Visits Fade as Jails Set Up Video Units for Inmates and Families
